p: (1) Active Ingredient. All parts of the plant contain alkaloids ( Figure 6): hyoscyamine (a), atropine (b), and scopolamine (c). Their quantities and proportions vary according to the species considered, the part of the plant, and the environmental conditions. Datura plants have a total alkaloid content of 0.2% to 0.6%; the third is scopolamine; two-thirds are of hyoscyamine and atropine. Young plants would be richer in scopolamine than adult plants [ 17].
